intro: Salix × fragilis f. sublaxiflora, commonly known as the silky willow, is a hybrid willow species characterized by its delicate, silky-haired leaves. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its narrow, lance-shaped leaves are often hairy on the upper surface, giving it a soft, silvery appearance. It produces catkins in early spring, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
